commit.message:
Explicitly detect the system's Pidgin plugin directory

This will have different behavior depending on the pkg-config version
of the system where distribution files are generated.  (I wrote a macro
included in pkg-config 0.28, which is still fairly new and uncommon, so
this change needed a fallback test.)

If the system uses pkg-config older than 0.28, it should preserve the
existing behavior.  The configure script will define plugindir to be
'${libdir}/pidgin' (Pidgin's default), and it can be overridden on the
make command line (i.e. "make install plugindir=~/.purple/plugins").

If the system uses pkg-config with version at least 0.28, a configure
variable pidgin_plugindir is declared precious.  It will be set to the
plugindir value from Pidgin's pkg-config settings if it was not already
overridden by environment variables.  (This is the same as pidgin_LIBS
and pidgin_CFLAGS.)  It will default to '${libdir}/pidgin' again if the
pkg-config calls fail.  The resulting value of pidgin_plugindir is used
as plugindir in the Makefile, which can be overriden as above.

Add a G_VALUE_INIT compatibility definition

Have configure detect systems with a glib-2.0 version older than 2.30
(e.g. Debian Squeeze) and provide the G_VALUE_INIT definition.
Prevent the Buddy List window from intercepting Ctrl+Tab keys

Process queued focus events before focusing the conversation entry field

The "conversation-created" handler was sometimes called in the odd situation of
running before queued focus events for the Buddy List's tree view.  This will
process all of those events before attempting to focus the entry field.

Include instructions for preparing source from the git repository

This file should be displayed on the main project page at GitHub.  It provides
information about using GNU autotools that is otherwise only present on the
project wiki.  These instructions are only relevant to the pre-distribution-tar
environment, so they are not included by "make dist".
Refocus the conversation entry field after removing the dummy tab
Support the Add/Remove Programs method of uninstalling

Disable building translations

This is a temporary switch to prevent build systems from requiring installed
internationalization development files.  It will be reverted in master once a
PO file has been added to the project.  Until then, anyone wishing to test out
their own localization files can revert this themselves.

Add support for building translations

This only includes the pieces necessary to build the PO files and does not
include any PO files themselves.  When the project is built, it will create the
POT file under the "po" directory.  This can be run through msginit to write a
PO file.  The language code can then be appended to "po/LINGUAS", and then the
translation file will be built after a reconfigure.

Exclude "Send To" from the migrated menu items

This menu item is destroyed and recreated every time the active conversation
tab is changed.  It is then hard-coded into the third menu position, which will
mess up the ordering of Buddy List menu items.  The least confusing solution is
to simply not include the menu in the merged window until its behavior is fixed
in Pidgin, or to wait until Pidgin is ported to GTK >= 3.2 when a signal is
finally implemented for when items are added to menus.

Rewrite the menu item visibility function to reparent the items

Instead of doing something such as adjusting widget visibility (as is done by
Pidgin Encryption) or adjusting widget sensitivity (as is done by Pidgin itself
with "Send To"), simply move the items back to their original window to disable
them.  This should avoid any conflicts with other plugins' widget properties.

The reason they are placed back into their own window (as opposed to simply
unparenting) is to reorder and retrieve any other items that were added to the
conversation menu bar by enabling other plugins.  The conversation window's
structure can theoretically be pointed at the Buddy List's menu bar once the
"Send To" menu in Pidgin is adjusted to have sane behavior, which would allow
new items to be added directly to the merged window.

Handle cases when the last conversation in the window is being hidden

This will prevent the Buddy List from being destroyed when its final remaining
conversation is hidden, e.g. by closing a persistent chat.  When conversations
are hidden, they are treated as if they were deleted from the window.

Mark the release of Window Merge 0.3

I am feeling tempted to start pushing some bigger change sets, so I'll cut a
new release while things are still relatively functional.  There have been a
decent number of fixes and improvements since the last version marker, meaning
this should be a noticeable upgrade for people who aren't building from git.
Revised documentation files for version 0.3

Add some logic for when to display the window after it splits

The conversation window seemed to be displayed briefly before it was destroyed
as the plugin was disabled.  Now the conversation window will only be displayed
if it is not in its death throes when the dummy conversation is removed.

Display the software license in the Windows installer

This commit is more of a complete rewrite than the subject suggests, but I do
not want a polluted git history because of this file.  Most changes are due to
my paying closer attention to NSIS documentation, such as it explicitly lists
pages now because implicit pages were deprecated.  The script's layout was also
reorganized because this is a censored version of the file from my local branch
with translations and a second plugin.  Those sections will now add cleanly in
the future if I ever get around to distributing that stuff.

Rewrite the accelerator group blocks

The way that code looked was making me angry.

GCC warns about an uninitialized variable--silence its lies

This also removes some obsolete file description comments.

Supply a script to build a Windows installer

I'm already providing an RPM spec, so why not?  This can be executed directly
as a script on a Unix-like system with makensis installed, or makensis can run
on it in a more traditional manner.  (The installer will only build once "make"
has succeeded at building the plugin.)

It simply looks at the Pidgin registry entry for its installation path (if it's
defined and still valid), or otherwise defaults to %ProgramFiles%\Pidgin.  With
that path, after verifying pidgin.exe is indeed in there, it writes the plugin
DLL to the plugins folder and creates an uninstaller at the main path.

For now, this is probably only useful for users who are unable to locate their
%AppData%\.purple\plugins folder.  However, in the future, it could simplify
installing and removing translations etc. in addition to the plugin itself.

Clear message notifications when the Buddy List window is focused

This works by synthesizing a focus event for the conversation window itself, so
anything important that could be added to the Pidgin focus event handler in the
future should also be executed here.

Preserve the original conversation window for when the windows are split

The conversation GtkWindow should now remain hidden during the entire time the
plugin is enabled, rather than freeing it immediately.  This window is simply
reconstructed from its old parts and displayed when the plugin is disabled.  It
should automatically destroy itself if the plugin is disabled while there are
no conversations open in it.

Define and use a widget replacement function

The widget replacement function will preserve the widget's position among its
siblings and all of its child properties (from its parent container).  By using
this instead of directly adding widgets to containers, most of the theoretical
conflicts with other GTK plugins should be avoided.

Only widgets in a GtkBox or GtkPaned parent can be replaced for the moment, but
I haven't encountered any other parent classes for the relevant widgets anyway.

Explicitly remove the dummy conversation from its window before freeing

This is to avoid any scenario where the conversation window could reference the
pointer to freed memory.

Refactor the convenience functions for storing pointers on a Buddy List

Normally, this type of thing should be in real functions.  However, seeing dual
namespace prefixes per call was driving me insane, and I did not want to
introduce string manipulation code to adjust the reference names.

Side note: These can now be called with either the Buddy List or its merged
conversation window for accessing the same data.

Be consistent with the dummy conversation function interface

The initialization function wasn't abstracting accesses to the dummy tab's
structure like the others.  This is really a cosmetic change to standardize.

Add a fallback option to the conversation placement function

If the conversation placement function is called while the Buddy List is not
fused with a conversation window, lots of pain would result.  This will now use
the "last opened window" placement function (the Pidgin default) if the Buddy
List is not merged.

I didn't realize that the placement function is still used even when the plugin
is disabled (despite deregistering everything).  That oversight probably caused
lots of problems for anyone trying to disable the plugin without restarting.

Locate the Buddy List menu bar using menutray instead of main_vbox

This should hopefully be more future-proof and less error-prone than assuming
the menu bar is in a certain position as a child widget.  It's also shorter.

Pass the Buddy List as signal data instead of attaching it to the widget

There is no sense in associating additional pointers to the paned widget when
its signals have unused data pointers.  For consistency with the disconnect
functions, this also switches to g_object_connect instead of g_signal_connect.

Have the size pref handlers determine orientation using the Buddy List

This is one step toward compatibility with my attempt at a conversation tiling
plugin.  The conversations' pane will be another GtkPaned when it is split, so
this now uses the untouched Buddy List's pane instead instead of the notebook
from the conversation window.

Move user-visible string definitions to the proper header

These should not have gone in the plugin configuration header in the first
place.
